sense.def: children of dignitaries
the senior ministers and dignitaries
offspring, the younger generation; junior members of the family; scion
kind of poetry
intone formally (poetry, not necessarily by heart: HANSHU 62 p. 2714-5); recite emphatically (distinguished prose); preach
kind of dance
kind of melody, tune
one-legged monster
after N, from N onwards
offend against, fail to obey; infringe, violate (laws etc) 民不敢犯法
the impartial law of the land =國法
administrative practice: impartial (public and not personal or private) rule of law
publicised and formally promulgated set of legal rules setting the official calendar of events
old and venerated (of non-animate things); possessed for a long time
laws and regulations

tls:text.tls:line: In times past the Ch'in [dynasty] acted contrary to principle

sense.def: HF 2.7.14 not too long ago
如是之甚 "as intensely as that" modifying an adverb
flee to N in order to V

the whole clan, all the members of one's clan in the broadest sense of the term (NB: It remains an open question whether this term refers to the group as a whole, as one thing, or to the menmbers of the group, as a plural term. I.e. the question is whether the Chinese hypostatised or reified a family or clan "as such".)
travel companion; friends in different places
LSCQ: small home town
southern barbarians
guess
army; the members of the army (traditionally 2500 men)
execution (by someone 吏誅 "execution by an official")
be exposed to a punishment; submit to (being executed), subject oneself to
SHU, GUAN: refers generally to the application of criminal law to criminals
lose (e.g. a fingernail); ZGC: have run away from one, lose from one's herd (a goat)

seg.line: 而世又不與能死節者比，

sense.def: die for (a ruler etc); sacrifice one's life in the cause of N

tls:text.tls:srcline: 而世又不與能死節者比，

sense.def: standard of behaviour, pattern of behaviour; code of proper conduct
wisdom; BUDDH: perfect insight, wisdom skr. prajñā
be exhausted ???
criminal offence, deliberate illegal act; punishable crime; grave fault
be extreme
cause to escape, rescue
emphatic sentence final particle: and that's how it is, and there is nothing to add to this matter, and that's all to it
than (introduces the object of comparison after a stative verb in comparative)
than (introduces the object of comparison after a stative verb in comparative)
